intro: Cosmea, commonly known as the "Chinese bellflower," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped or tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors, including pink, purple, white, and yellow. The plants typically have upright stems and are often grown as ornamental garden plants due to their attractive appearance. Cosmea species are native to various regions in Asia, particularly China, and some are also found in North America. They thrive in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making them popular choices for gardeners seeking vibrant, easy-to-care-for blooms.
